items.summary: Four passengers in a van, who are yet to be formally identified, died at the scene, north of Shepparton in Victoria. Five injured people, including three children and the male driver, were taken to various hospitals.

items.title: Darwin filmmaking program gives storytellers with disabilities a platform
items.summary: Aspiring Darwin filmmakers with disabilities have been getting job-ready, developing skills in scriptwriting, directing, cinematography and editing. It is the first time the program has been offered in the NT, with plans for it to expand even further.

items.title: Richmond takes Olivia Wolmarans with top pick in the 2025 AFLW draft, Suns complete raid
items.summary: Richmond takes Olivia Wolmarans with the top pick in the AFLW draft, as the Suns complete a stunning raid.

items.title: Bondi Beach shooting gunman Naveed Akram was follower of pro-Islamic State preacher Wisam Haddad
items.summary: At least one of the gunmen who killed 15 people in Sunday's Bondi Beach terrorist attack was known to authorities as a follower of a notorious Sydney pro-Islamic State cleric, the ABC can reveal.

items.title: Inquest into Sonya Dutton's death in outback NSW hears of 'many unanswered questions'
items.summary: Barkindji mother-of-two Sonya Dutton, 31, was found in her family's Wilcannia residence on March 29, 2022 — four days after she was reportedly last seen.

items.title: Christmas Day weather forecast points to heatwave, tropical storms and festive sunshine
items.summary: With only nine more sleeps until Christmas, we have now entered the meteorological window of predictability — in other words, forecasts are more accurate than just guessing the weather.

items.title: Magic mushroom warning as Nimbin farmer fed up with trespassing foragers
items.summary: A farmer is concerned for the safety of people foraging for magic mushrooms, which he has sprayed with herbicide, as a toxicologist warns about the dangers of fungi.

items.title: NSW Premier Chris Minns defends police response to Bondi Beach terror attack
items.summary: NSW Premier Chris Minns has defended the police response to Sunday's Bondi Beach terror attack, saying officers acted with "bravery and integrity".

items.title: Bondi Beach shooting: Community pays tribute to terror victims
items.summary: An act of terror took the lives of 15 people at Bondi. Their names, stories and legacies are held close by a shaken, grieving community.

items.title: Bondi attack caused by 'cascading hate' left unchecked, say critics urging antisemitism plan be adopted
items.summary: A report that has sat on Prime Minister Anthony Albanese's desk for months is being raised by critics as key evidence that the federal government has done too little, too late to respond to the rising tide of antisemitism since the October 7 terror attack in Israel.

items.title: What Australia can learn from the great Kiwi interest rate hike experiment
items.summary: The RBA's interest rate-cutting cycle is at an end, and now a hardcore handful of critics say they shouldn't have cut rates in the first place. Conveniently, you only need to look across the ditch to see what could've happened if we'd followed that path.

items.title: It's author Jane Austen's 250th birthday, and her books still have lessons for us today
items.summary: Her books like Pride and Prejudice and Emma were written hundreds of years ago, but have themes that still resonate in today's society.

items.title: Tasmanian parliament passes new sentencing laws, leading to stronger punishments for hate crimes
items.summary: The Tasmanian government's new laws to protect people from targeted violence have sailed through the state's parliament, with experts celebrating their "innovative" approach. But some say the job is not done yet, with work still needed to implement them successfully.

items.title: After being run over by a car while sunbaking, Sam reunites with paramedics who saved her
items.summary: Melbourne woman Samantha Hind was sunbaking on her lawn when her husband ran over her. After recovering from the brink of death, she is reunited with the paramedics who saved her life.

items.title: Bondi Beach shooting updates: Police promise 'highly visible, precise and around-the-clock' investigation — as it happened
items.summary: Bondi Beach will remain a crime scene, with security around Sydney's eastern suburbs bolstered.

items.title: McLeod's Daughters star Rachael Carpani dies aged 45
items.summary: Rachael Carpani had recently appeared on long-running Australian soap Home and Away and frequently spoke out on a range of issues, including the need to address domestic violence.

items.title: Communities pay tribute to Bondi shooting victims in Sydney and Melbourne vigils
items.summary: Crowds gather at Bondi to lay floral tributes and mourn, just 24 hours removed from a mass shooting that left 15 people dead.

items.title: Suzi Milgate defends crepe attack on former NT chief minister Natasha Fyles as 'protest', during assault trial
items.summary: A former Darwin real estate agent charged with assaulting the Northern Territory's then-chief minister with a plate of crepes has tried to justify her actions as a "protest" against COVID-19 rules.

items.title: Man charged with murder of woman in Adelaide's parklands
items.summary: Police have arrested a 37-year-old man for the alleged murder of a woman who was found unresponsive in Adelaide's parklands in January.

items.title: Nathan Lyon insists he has nothing to prove in Adelaide ahead of Test return

items.title: CAR T-cell cancer therapy to be available in SA from mid-2026
items.summary: The number of critical patients having to travel interstate to receive CAR T-cell therapy will be reduced from mid-next year, with SA to launch a service at the Royal Adelaide Hospital.

items.summary: Also spelt Chanukah, the eight-day celebration observed by Jewish people around the world carries a message of resilience and positivity — one that a Melbourne rabbi said would endure despite the Bondi Beach terrorist attack.

items.title: NSW inquest told how exploding lithium-ion batteries caused volatile fires killing three
items.summary: A NSW inquest has been told exploding lithium-ion batteries caused volatile fires killing three people in separate blazes within minutes.

items.summary: WA Premier Roger Cook condemns the "cowardly and heinous" attack in Bondi, after meeting with Jewish leaders in Perth as police increase patrols.

items.summary: A man who caused the death of an elderly couple while driving with methamphetamine in his blood is ordered to complete 100 hours of community service and four months of home detention.

items.summary: An urgent meeting of national cabinet agrees to strengthen Australia's gun laws in the wake of the Bondi Beach shooting.

items.summary: Anthony Albanese's first responsibility after the horrific Bondi terror attack is to lead a grieving nation. His next will be to explain how this happened.
